reviewText: I finally buckled down and bought this for $9.99. I had been hesitating to do so, knowing that the amount of content that you get is very very small - especially considering that the whale encounter is free through transport. I don't regret the purchase, and won't be refunding it. You get maybe 10 minutes of total content outside of the whale experience, I didn't time it, but it wasn't a lot. It's two different scenarios, but both of them were definitely longer than the whale expeience, and just as stunning the entire time. Know going into this that you're not going to get a lot of content... but what content there is is probably the most gorgeous that exists on the vive thus far.\n\nMy one complaint would be that you can't just sit in the scenarios once they end, they go to credits and you have to select them again. I really wish the devs would implement either just an automatic repeat without credits in between with an exit button, or just an environment that you could sit in because the reef migration would be an incredibly relaxing way to spend an hour meditating.

reviewText: I finally set up my Vive yesterday, and theBlue was first on my hit list for a number of reasons; however, one reason in particular stuck out.  When I was a kid, I wanted to be a marine biologist more than anything. As an adult, I became an accountant. The overwhelming beauty of this experience has caused me to have an mini existential crisis, and has made me wish I would have pursued my underwater dreams. At least, in a small way, I can now. Thank you theBlue. I wholeheartedly recommend purchasing this. It is worth every penny.

reviewText: This is an amazing experience. The whale level was a little too short, I wanted to remain there for awhile longer, sit on the shipwreck, and play with the fish. Unfortunately, when the credits roll, the level is over. Would appreciate being allowed to stay as long as I want. The other two levels were also amazing, particularly the Abyss. Wow! Sitting on the bottom of an abyss, inside whale bones, with a flashlight -- it was an awesome, immersive, relaxing experience. For $11, definitely worth the money. Please create more levels and don't force us out when the level ends -- allow us to stay as long as we like. Looking forward to more VR titles like this!

reviewText:
Video coverage here, text coverage below:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=WXLVEt2v8pM

theBlue is a very short ocean experience placing you into certain environments and situations consiting of 3 episodes. One is a Reef Migration where you watch turtles, manta rays, fish do their thing as a huge swarm of jellyfish migrates across your path.  Whale Encounter brings you up close with a traveling whale. Luminous Abyss (my personal favorite) drops you into the bottom of the ocean where there is no natural light... barring a few strange aquatic animals.

This is not a game but an experience; there are no goals, no points, no loss conditions. There is some interaction; you can bop jellyfish and scare off fish, for example. For the most part however you're observing and immersing yourself into the ocean.

Options are limited. The Luminous Abyss episode allows you to slow down time so that you can enjoy it for longer. It also allows for screenshots. The other 2 episodes are missing these options and I'm not sure why.

With that in mind, it's a very good experience and is now one of my go-tos for showing people new to VR just what it's about. The ambient music, sound effects, and movement of the environments really allow you to get sucked into it. Be warned: this is very short. Going through all 3 episodes will take roughly 20-30 minutes.  Given the $10 this may be a bit much for what is offered.

Overall this a good, albeit pricey experience and is great for demonstration if you're the Show all my friends/family" type."
voteText: 2 of 2 people (100%) found this review helpful

reviewText: I love this! Please make more. Even longer sessions would be great. It would be really neat if there was a night dive of a reef that you could explore all the little holes and cracks in the reef with your light. This was well worth the price of admission!
Great experience.
Really cool VR experiences. Great for demoing to people new to VR.

Just jaw-droppingly amazing. Honestly, I find that I'm enjoying these VR 'experiences' the same amount - if not more - than the games. If you've been following the Vive at all, then you've no doubt heard about the 'Whale' experience, and it's amazing, but it's just the tip of the iceberg: The other two experiences in this pack are even more mindblowing. You just totally feel transported. It's beautiful, just beautiful. And fantastic for demoing to other people as their first taste of VR: I always start with the whale, and then go on to the second one - which is just majestic - before the dark one. Truly worth every penny of the asking price; in fact, I'd say it'd be worth it at three times the amount the developer is asking.
A blutiful experience, and a great demo. Is it worth the price - probably not - but as a launch experience"
date: it's certainly worth it. I just hope more substantial games could be made to such high quality.\n\nAnd in case you're scared of sharks: there aren't any!"

reviewText: Definitely one of the best to show people their first VR demo's
Great for showing off your VR gear!
I recommend this game purely on the basis that it is a great way to introduce VR newbies to the magically world of immersion. Beyond that, there isn't too much to do, besides look at fish swim by.
Just awesome!   Could use some more fish / environments, but a great experience and must show to anyone who comes to your house to see a VR Experience.

Bought this experience mainly from reviews as I wanted to use this as an introduction to VR to my wife. She was completely blown away.
I felt I would be a 5 min, yeah very nice but bring me some action. But this is such a nice experience I found myself just sitting on the floor and chilling out. Was so relaxing.
The fact that it does change each time is also a nice touch.
Improvements would be the following: ability to feed the fish by pressing the trigger button!
Ability to teleport around the scene so you can look in and under the objects without the chaperone walls showing
Please include these features!

This is a fantastic introduction to VR immersion.  This is the first experience I have people try when they are new to VR.  I have had children to grandparents try it.  They have all been very impressed.  This is a first day purchase for any new VR headset owners.

A wonderful set of VR experiences. These are ideal for VR demos. I've had about 15 different people try it and they've all been blown away. In my opinion it's on the same level of graphical polish as Valve's The Lab. Although this has almost no interaction in it.\n\nIt's one of the most realistic experiences currently out there.

Incase you haven't gathered from the other reviews by now, this is NOT a game, and NOT really much interactivity either.  It's a series of short tech demos, designed to show off the power and potential of VR.

When I first ran this and realised I couldn't move around, or do much of anything, I thought, thank god for Valve's refund policy.  Seeing the whale swim by was neat in the first part, but it wasn't until I saw- no, make that experienced- the 2nd part that I was blown away by the simulation, and by the true potential of VR.

Remember the first time you experienced 3D in the cinemas, and you find yourself reaching out with your hands to interact with the scene?  I did the same thing with this, and it was incredible.  Having fishes swim up to you, and then reacting and darting away when you reach out to touch them... seeing the jellyfishes ripple as you go to brush them away.  Looking up and seeing the swam of creatures floating above, and then finding yourself standing up from your chair and turning 360 degrees to follow their movement...

Will I play this again?  Probably not.  But do I recommand this?  Yes.  Don't think of this as a game.  Think of it as an experience.  Like going diving, or paying for a ticket to go into an aquarium in real life.  The price might be steep for a tech demo, but for the experience you are paying for in VR, it is well worth the price of entry.

While the whale encounter gets all the media, The abyss is by far the most immersive in my opinion. not massively taken with the reef one but overall a fabulous experience and a great way to show off VR.

I feel obligated to write a quick review because of how amazing this experience was. This completely blew me away, the detail is amazing and the immersion is real. The whale experience is great (dev's please do a shark one) but the Reef is to behold. The reef is an experience that words cannot describe. You need to experience it for yourself. It was worth every penny, dev's please bring more.

reviewText:
All three experiences are breathtakingly beautiful.

Even though I've owned all of the developer kits from Oculus over the last few years I think I experienced 'presence' for the first time with this experience. This was while sitting at the bottom of the ocean in the Luminous Abyss deep sea episode. The darknewss and murkiness of the water  adds to the believability of the whole experience. Crawling along the floor with my dive torch to investigate an Angler Fish in an underwater cave was pretty awesome. The torch even triggers phosphorescent algae!

Does anyone know where the pictures you take when using Inspect Mode are stored on the local drive? I want to email some of them to some friends.

Can't reccomend this enough.

All three experiences are breathtaking.

Even though I've owned all of the developer kits from Oculus over the last few years I believe I experienced 'presence' for the first time with theBlu. This was while sitting at the bottom of the ocean in the Luminous Abyss deep sea episode. The darkness and murkiness of the water adds to the believability of the whole experience. Crawling along the floor with my dive torch to investigate an Anglerfish located in an underwater cave was one of the best things I've experienced in VR. The torch even triggers phosphorescent algae!

Can't recommend this enough and can't wait for the next instalment.

reviewText: Wow!  I have SCUBA dived multiple times and this game really makes me feel like I am underwater again. reviewText: Yes it seems expensive but it is beautiful (and sometimes terrifying). A week ago when I had no prior VR experience and my Vive was still somewhere in the Czech Republic I watched a youtube video of this game and thought well that's cool but not really that amazing.". Turns out I was wrong.\n\nThis is one of these games where videos just don't do it justice. I was really really scared when this huge whale approached me and looked at me for what seemed like an eternity. My GF and my mom both totally lost their shi t when they tried it and could not look at the whale because they were so scared. My mom screamed her soul out. This game is no joke
date:
you totally forget you are standing in your small room grinning (or screaming) like an idiot.

Apart from the famous whale level there are two more which are equally amazing but much longer. I won't spoil them for you because I think part of the experience is the fact that you don't expect what's coming up next.

One level
hoursPlayed: was very relaxing. You could interact with the water plants around you and it was a very peaceful scene. The sounds and the lighting made it even more relaxing so I just sat down on my floor and got carried away. I think there is even more potential to these relaxing levels - just imagine sitting in a nice part of the ocean for half an hour to relax until you go to bed.\n\nIt is a really unique experience and one of the greatest. I will use this to show people how amazing VR can be. Thanks for making this
votesFunny: 1 of 2 people (50%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
While this game only includes 3 relatively short experiences; it is a perfect choice for showing off your new VR toy to your friends and family.

Each experience has minimal interaction - a torch in one experience, and also the ability to interact with fishies (they'll try to avoid your hands!), but that is perfect for demo'ing the technology to beginners so they can get a feel for moving their hands (controllers) around and walking around a fairly contained area.

I've yet to show this to anyone who hasn't been blown away by the whale swimming past.

$10 is fairly high for what is effectively a pretty short 3 experiences. But if you're planning on showing VR to anyone who isn't a gamer - this is the game to use.

reviewText: I just can't recommend this game for the price.  If you see it for $1 and want a very brief kind of pretty experience, it isn't a total rip off.  This is just a few short tech demos where you stand around a pretty underwater landscape unable to move beyond the bounds of the room.  There is almost no interaction.  There is no game.  At $10 (the price as I am review this) this is an awful rip off of a demo.  This should be nearly free.

reviewText: I have a beautiful screen grab from theBlu sitting on my desktop at work, of the turtle swimming near the sun when I was looking up at the water’s surface in the Reef Migration sequence. Whenever my eyes wander over to that side of my desktop, I have an urge to open the pic, gaze at it, and just remember the time I took that screen grab. It isn’t like recalling playing a game or watching a movie. theBlu is exactly why I got a Vive. The experience is the thing I love about VR, and theBlu is a wonderful experience. As great as Reef Migration is, Luminous Abyss holds the trophy for my favorite use of VR thus far. I can appreciate great use of lighting, and that sequence, set in such darkness, just thrills me to no end when various natural lights start popping up. It’s something I wish I could show to everyone.\nI hope Wevr does more of these, maybe with a bit more interaction woven in (poking jellyfish is good fun). There is most certainly a place for atmospheric experiences in VR, and Wevr has set the bar pretty high with theBlu.
Definitely a great VR ambiance experience.
Beautiful, pretty intense, but a bit short for now.
This game provides an amazing experience.  It is great to keep in your library for introducing to those new to VR!  The reactions are priceless.
Wow! Just simply a wonderous experience. The whale encounter is probably the most intense VR moment I have had so far.

Definately the first must-see for the HTC Vive. Short but impressive. I am a diver and this is cool - a good way to demonstrate what diving in RL is about.

Regards,
MoonshinE
Great immersive experiences to relive and also show  off to those new to VR. Looking forward to more!
mind blowing!!! my #1 goto for someones first expeirence.
Definitely a great VR ambiance experience.

The Blu is probably the best way to introduce someone to VR. It is a serene and beautiful experience with some light but mesmerizing interactive elements. The original Whale Encounter is still a great succinct experience but the new scenes give you a bit more time to hang out and they both contain probably the most impressive graphics available on the Vive at this time.\n\nThere is not a ton of content here but what is here is well worth the money and probably the best way to introduce anyone to VR.
The best sense of presence of any VR app I've tried. However, the whale scene crashes my computer hard about 50% of the time.

theBlu holds a very special place in my heart. Besides gaming, scuba diving is one of my favorite hobbies. theBlu, while short on content, is a very amazing experience. The beautiful visuals combined with the realistic ambient noises create an uncanny experience.  When I suspended by disbelief I was transported from my rural in-land living room to the bottom of the sea. The sense of peace is something I will carry to my grave.
The limited, yet, interactive experience of theBlu makes it the perfect introductory piece for all audiences.

The breath-taking experience has been the same for everyone that I've shown it too. Full grown adults have been instantly moved to childhood glee.

Gameplay Breakdown:
You do not move from your room-scale play area. The surrounding fauna is lightly interactive. Beyond that, you do not have any input besides aiming your flashlight. Walk around, get down on the ground, and enjoy the crafted experience from every angle.

Pros:
+Room-scale is topnotch with excellent headtracking.
+Striking visuals.
+Realistic sound effects.
+Interactive environment.
+The sense of scale is amazing.
+Each experience is unique.

Cons:
-Very short.
-Seriously, please give me more. I need it.

-Updates-
(4/28/16): Just showed this to my scuba diving partner and he agrees it's like we're back on vacation.
Definately one of the most immersive experience available right now, and probably the best experience to demo to friends who have never played VR before.
Out of the handful of experiences I have tried in the Vive so far, theBlu is at the top of the list! Awesome demo! Absolutely woth the price!
Fun little tech demos....??\nIf it ever becomes something like Ocean Rift in terms of content maybe it'll turn out great.
Great first VR experience for non gamers. Short and sweet but worth the low cost. High quality.
Short but, a-ma-zing...!

Gorgeous and a great way to experience and show off VR. I do recommend it but with the warning that the whole thing can be experienced in about 10 minutes. Unless you're dying for a set piece to show off with, I'd recommend catching this on sale or waiting to see if more content is added to justify the current $10 price tag.

Absolutely beautiful.  Probably the best looking experience I've seen.  All three scenes are crafted so well.   There isn't nearly enough life in the first generation of VR content, but this one is just full of it.  All the animals are so believable, especially ones I'm familiar with in real life, such as large Crabs.  Totally convincing, so much so the Deep see experience was hard quite scary at first, almost didn't want to keep going, but I did and it was totally worth it.  Only downside is I want more.
This is totally worth it just so you can show everyone the Whale Encounter. So cool.

I have a beautiful screen grab from theBlu sitting on my desktop at work, of the turtle swimming near the sun when I was looking up at the water’s surface in the Reef Migration sequence. Whenever my eyes wander over to that side of my desktop, I have an urge to open the pic, gaze at it, and just remember the time I took that screen grab. It isn’t like recalling playing a game or watching a movie. theBlu is exactly why I got a Vive. The experience is the thing I love about VR, and theBlu is a wonderful experience. As great as Reef Migration is, Luminous Abyss holds the trophy for my favorite use of VR thus far. I can appreciate great use of lighting, and that sequence, set in such darkness, just thrills me to no end when various natural lights start popping up. It’s something I wish I could show to everyone.\nI hope Wevr does more of these, maybe with a bit more interaction woven in (poking jellyfish is good fun). There is most certainly a place for atmospheric experiences in VR, and Wevr has set the bar pretty high with theBlu.

An absolutely delightful, relaxing, undesea jaunt willed with immersive visuals. Everything is textured for up-close observation and in some cases, interaction. I will be using this to introduce my friends to VR on a regular basis. ^_^
Just...breathtaking. My wife just lay on the floor for 30 minutes enjoying the underwater atmosphere.

Unless you're dying for a set piece to show off with, I'd recommend catching this on sale or waiting to see if more content is added to justify the current $10 price tag.

Fantastic. On the pricey side for ~20 mins of content, but such great quality content is worth it!

A strict warning: Do not purchase if you don't have the minimum spec (GTX 980 / R9 Fury). My R9 390

Yep, this is the go to experience to show off VR. Nuff said...its good, real good

This is a VR demo, not a game. You will try it a few times, show it to family and friends and that will be it.

However, the quality of this demo is so fantastic that, considering the realtively low price, it is still worth the price for a VR experience (in which we are all newbie at this time).

This is the first piece of software I fired up when I got my Vive, and in non-game terms pretty much still the best. It doesn't last very long, and there isn't much to do, but if you want to show somebody what VR is all about, theBlu is what you want.\n

All three episodes in this bundle are mighty impressive, each for their own reasons. If you're looking for a demo to give your friends a taste of VR, look no further. Allthough being a bit pricey, I can recommend this title. However, be aware that there is no gameplay, it's purely an experience.

This isn't really a game, it's just a collection of ocean scenes. That being said, the scenes it offers are downright amazing. The simulated environments are stunning to look at and offer a great sense of presence. Whenever I enter one of the scenes I really feel like I'm there at the bottom of the ocean! Really, there are no words to describe how frickin cool that is!\n\nHighly recommended.
the game is stuck on main menu is the game broken?
Amazing demo of what VR can do, breathtaking.  Wish there was more substance to it though.
Really great but short VR experience - really great as a quick vr demo for visitors

Let me put it this way: if you have money to spend get it. It's great to show the abilities of VR via this to friends and family. However if you are tight on budget and are wondering if it's worth I would say save your money and either wait until it goes on sale, or wait till more content is added.\n\nCurrently you can go through the whole experience in about 10-20minutes. Once done, it's just repetition. To be fair it is pretty cool  thou the first time you play it.

Very enjoyable, an excellent showcase. I usually fire this up when people come over to ease them in... right before I sick the maniacal Sister doll on them.\nNot a single person that I've seen try this dislikes the experience, quite the opposite in fact. I remember seeing videos of this before I received the Vive and just knew I HAD to walk on that very same sunken ship. I don't regret buying this, but I'm pretty sure I won't be booting this up unless they add new content. Or a virtual harpoongun.

My virst VR experience with my Vive, absolutely amazing, particulalry the third dark experience.  For me personally the price tag is a bargain, yes it is short but as my first VR experience it completely blew me away.  Beautiful.
I love this experience! It's not super long, but it is so beautiful and very relaxing! The luminous jellyfish are mesmerizing!
Just AWESOME VR experience ! This will be my go-to game to demonstate VR to my friends and family !!!
really nice to see the reactions of my friends when they meet the wale..

This is something I keep showing people, its so incredibly imersive, you honestly feel like you are under the ocean. Really nice work on these.


Not much in terms of replayability but its worth a purchase to experience this.

Its short but OMG it is amazing. It is such a great showcase piece for VR. Having an 80 foot whale in your living room is a remarkable experience. I actually got a bit scared in the dark segment. (I have a fear of deep dark water LOL) I highly recommend this experience. You will be in awe!

Amazing quality! Near-photographic GFX quality, you really feel like being under water.

Quite short but if you love water stuff, it's worth every penny!

Perfect demo to show your friends

The sense of presence in this game is awesome. Is it a game? No. Is it enjoyable? Yes, absolutely.

If I were purchasing it just for myself, it probably would have just barely been worth the $10 pricetag. But factoring in the ability to share the experience with friends and family and the game has been well worth the cost.

I hope that the developers continue to develop similar content and would be excited to see what sort of possibilities for an actual game might be in this kind of immersive and visually stunning environment.

This is basically 3 short movies of the power of the Vive.  Its worth the 10 I paid and the graphics are outstanding.  Being able to peer into things and walk to the edge of the ship is just great.  Get this just to show off VR to anyone that visits.
15 minutes worth of content, but totally worth it - this will be the first thing I load up when showing VR off to friends
Stunning.  The best thing to demo the Vive so far imo.

Completely engrossing and presence as well as it has been done to date in VR. Great to show off VR to a newcomer, awesome to experience and the casual" mode makes for a great backdrop to just relax for 15 minutes after a long day. Would love to see more from the developer."

This is simply a tech demo.\n\nBut I have to say it's one of the most beautiful tech demos the Vive has to offer. It easily shows off the capibility of this platform, and what's to come in the future from this platform. I wish there were more scenes to view besides the 3 short ones. OR I wish the price was a lot less. For 10 bucks, You might be able to go better with another tech demo... HOWEVER, with the price, and how short the experiences are. I still have to say that this is one of the most enjoyable purchases I've made for the Vive. The whale scene is breathtaking, and makes me extremely excited to see the future of VR.
Very polished top quality VR experience.

This would be a lot of fun to just turn on and zone out and relax in. Unfortunately, it doesn't let you do that because each scene automatically ends after a minute or two and it kicks you back to the title screen. Strange design choice. (Edit: Apparently there is an ambient mode" that you can unlock by playing through a scene twice. This lets you stay in a scene.)\n\nMostly this is something you will use to demo VR to a friend. It's easy to just turn it on and make someone say "wow". Note that you can't really interact with the environment or do anything but look around. It's very pretty
Beautiful and immersive.  Worth every penny.

This is the first experience I show to every new person that I demo my Vive to... it usually blows people away. The whale experience and the turtle experience are amazing. The graphics are fantastic and there's limited interaction which is good for someones first go with VR.
Great build quality, awesome slow intro to VR. Needs to get cheaper.
Very beuautiful expirience, but i´d say it´s overpriced~ very short.\nI recommend waiting for a sale.
Okay, this is not a game this is 3 small mini sceens that you stand around and wish something cool would happen.  worth $5 not 10.

I read fantastic reviews for this, and it is neat, but it is just a tech demo SLIGHTLY interactive video.   I think it is hard to put a price on this type of media as there has been quite a lot of work to produce it but for what it is, it is over priced ($2 would be fair I believe - to give to the developers and maybe they will make a actual interactive game).  I would still recommend this as it is a low motionsick demo to show company and the graphics are excellent for the whale.

reviewText: The best demo for those new to VR.

This is not actually a game. If this was not VR then it would be nothing but a movie. And actually extremely short movie. However it is an exciting VR experience. You stand there, the things happen around you. You decide where to look. You can even make a step or crouch to get a better view. If you wanted to see the difference between 3D movie and Virtual Reality movie then this makes an excellent example.\n\nThe only problem I have is that is really short. While I do not regret the money I admit that the performance per dollar" is bad."

It's just a Small Demo of Being under the sea with only 3 Scenes,  so far.
You do kind of feel your under the water....
Perfect to show people VR.
Not much to it.... but still worth the money to me....

I'll be trying it a lot.......as short as it is.....
I love this - it's stunning & relaxing. I've been putting everyone who calls over in here for a taster of my ney toy and watch their jaws drop
These are great to show friends/family. They are short but really amazing. my i5 4440 struggles to run the reef migration/Luminous Abyss while the whale one was flawless. Time to upgrade CPU!

Holy awesomesauce Batman!

Short, and limited, but so very very cool.  This is the one program that I always launch when demoing the Vive.  The sense of presence and scale are insane and the developers did a really awesome job here.

I will note however that this requires a bit more beef in your pc than just the Vive specs may lead you to believe.  I had some strange instances of lag in scenes happen only when the sun is in a certain spot. (strange?)

This is a must have if you are looking to see what the hardware can do/and/or you are trying to show it off.  My kid tried it and said wow at least once every 30 seconds, he was blown away, and so was I.

Recommended for sure.
Just a great experience
The best demo for those new to VR.
It's neat, and a great way to demo VR to people, especially older people who may be easily overwhelmed. It's extremely polished, looks beautiful, and runs amazing.

reviewText: This was the first game" I played when I hooked up my VIVE.  The experience was completely immersive and everyone in the house was blown away!!!  Worth the price just so people can experience VR in a simple way!!!"
The price is high for just 3 scenes. It should be a 4.99 price tag. If they added more content i'd be ok with 9.99.\nThe reason i bought it was because its a good introduction to show people VR
Great set of experiences for first timers.

At first glance some may dismiss this as an expensive tech demo but to do so would be a huge mistake. This group of experiences have very high production values and are are without a doubt worth the entry price. At least one of these habitats will be used in every HTC Vive demo I run. Ultimately theBlu is one of the most immersive introduction options available and doesn't need users to tackle complex interactions or explanations, this is perfect for tech newcomers. I only recently found time to try Luminous Abyss and this is arguably the most impressive yet. I truly hope that Wevr produce more experiences like this in the future. If you are reading this review and have the PC specification required then don't hesitate... Thanks for the memories Wevr

A great way to demonstrate VR to newcomers. There's nothing too frightening going on here, but the experiences are really impressive. The small amount of interactivity isn't a big problem, but I do wish there were more scenes.
